alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Louisa; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 10:19AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Rock Island, northern Mercer, west central Whiteside, northwestern Henry, southwestern Carroll, central Louisa, eastern Cedar, Scott, Muscatine and Clinton Counties through 1100 AM CDT... At 1018 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Bennett to near Fruitland. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Moline, Rock Island, Bettendorf, Clinton, Muscatine, East Moline, Tipton, Durant, Silvis, Eldridge, DeWitt, Milan, Colona, Camanche, Le Claire, Coal Valley, Wilton, Hampton and Orion. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 265 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 10. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 15. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
